sentence.text: He simply could not fathom ` the ethical questions raised by me as his bishop " .
The morning after the funeral , Jean started trying to fathom the mysteries posed by the contents of Brian 's wallet .
For some reason I was unable to fathom , all the girls in my class at secondary school headed for Aviemore each weekend with the singular task of losing their virginity .
For the life of her she could n't fathom where funerals came into it .
Nor could he fathom how any daughter of his could be , either .
She watched him for several moments , then looked about the large dining-room , trying to fathom the reason for his actions .
` How you feelin' , mate ? " asked Charlie as he tried to fathom the expression on his friend 's face .
I remember looking him straight in the eye at this point in order to try and fathom the motives behind his proposal .
She could n't fathom the difference , but something about his mood made her feel uneasy .
Silas sent her a look she was unable to define , and even as she tried to fathom its meaning their gaze locked for several long moments until he reached across the table to squeeze her hand .
I never completely fathomed the relationship between Andrew and Judith Evelyn , both creatures of considerable intellect and high temperament , to say nothing of dramatic talent .
` It is difficult to fathom Government 's attitude to orderly potato marketing .
How any attempt was going to be made when she was in Mariánské Láznë and Ven in Prague , she had n't fathomed as she made her way down to breakfast .
It is hard to fathom the pain felt at the death of a son or daughter , husband or wife , partner or friend .
His personal character is difficult to fathom , but he had a capacity for deep and long-lasting friendships .
Ann found it very difficult to tell , just as she had found it difficult to fathom out the workings of Martha 's mind in the days before she and her twin were married .
But when I began to fathom the extent of British editorial obedience to America 's New York Times and NBC-TV , I got scared .
Late-twentieth century culture is hard enough to fathom , even if you live within its centrifugal core .
Sorry was on the tip of her tongue when a thought struck her with such force she lay back to fathom its meaning .
It could be that we are fatally drawn to the mysterious : the water is that which we can not fathom , the unfathomable .
Feel the texture of a hand offered in greeting and try to fathom the `` Jamaican handshake , '' a ritual whose rules seem to be more complex than those of the game of cricket .
